metadata.title: CVE-2016-10730 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Amanda 3.3.1. A user with backup privileges cantrivially compromise a client installation. Amstar is an Amanda ApplicationAPI script. It should not be run by users directly. It uses star to backupand restore data. It runs binaries with root permissions when parsing thecommand line argument --star-path.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

amanda-client - 1:3.5.1-1build2
amanda-common - 1:3.5.1-1build2
amanda-server - 1:3.5.1-1build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: amanda package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.1-1build2').
